label: Scheduling Appointments Based on Incoming Emails
description: When I get a new email, analyze the mail for the patient name, the type of appointment and doctor and the date-time. Get all free time slots that are at least 45 minutes long. Finally, send an email with all the available appointments.

tasks.label: Get an email from the trigger
tasks.name: googleMail_1

tasks.label: Convert the mail into a json
tasks.name: openAi_1

messages.content:
${googleMail_1.bodyPlain} 

Can you conclude from this message if someone is requesting an appointment? Who wants to schedule the appointment? On which day? At what time does the patient want to make the appointment?

response.responseSchema: {"type":"object","title":"Patient","properties":{"patientName":{"type":"string","title":"Patien Name"},"typeOfDoctor":{"type":"string","title":"Type of Doctor","description":"type of the doctor patient wants to see"},"appointmentDate":{"type":"string","title":"Appointment Data","format":"date-time"},"dateTimePeriod":{"type":"object","properties":{"startDateTime":{"type":"string","format":"date-time","title":"Start Time"},"endDateTime":{"type":"string","format":"date-time","title":"End Time"}},"title":"Date Time Period"}}}

iteratee.label: If a time slot is longer than 45 minutes
iteratee.name: condition_1

messages.content: ${dataStorage_2} Can you look at the start and end times of all these free time slots? Can you suggest a list of appointments? Each appointment lasts 45 minutes and can start at every quarter of an hour at 00, 15, 30, and 45. Appointments cannot overlap. Provide a response in the format "1. date of appointment start time - end time" and so on. Do not include any additional explanation.
